alert.note: Alert for Mineral (Nevada) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 22 at 3:28PM PDT until further notice by NWS Reno
info.description: ...The Flood Advisory continues for the following rivers in Nevada... Walker River near PT Site below Weber Reservoir near Schurz affecting Mineral County. .Ongoing snow melt will continue to produce flooding. For the Mainstem Walker River...including PT Site below Weber Reservoir near Schurz...moderate flooding will continue. ...FLOOD ADVISORY FOR SNOWMELT REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Flooding caused by snowmelt and reservoir releases are ongoing. * WHERE...Walker River near PT Site below Weber Reservoir near Schurz. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 18.5 feet, Moderate flooding below Weber Reservoir impacting agricultural land and access roads. River Bank instablilty may cause additional impacts. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 3:10 PM PDT Thursday the stage was 18.6 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 3:10 PM PDT Thursday was 18.7 feet. - Forecast...No forecast is available for this location. - Action stage is 16.5 feet. - Flood stage is 17.3 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: If you encounter a flooded roadway, turn around and find an alternative route. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.cnrfc.noaa.gov. The next statement will be issued Friday afternoon.
